search_input:
Stairs and their role in architecture

*Stairs have been a fundamental element in architectural design since ancient times, serving as a means of vertical circulation between floors. Their functionality is often overshadowed by more aesthetically prominent features, yet stairs can greatly impact the overall feel and functionality of a building. In modern architecture, stairs have become an integral part of the design process, with designers employing innovative materials and shapes to create visually striking and efficient staircases.*
